action plate and incubate at room temperature for 10 minutes;

(6) Use 1×Kinase buffer to prepare a mixed solution of ATP and Kinase substrate2 of 5/3 times the final concentration;

(7) Add 15 μL of a mixed solution of 5/3 times the final concentration of ATP and substrate to initiate the reaction;

(8) Centrifuge the 384-well plate at 1000 rpm for 30 seconds, shake and mix, and incubate at room temperature for 10 minutes;

(9) Add 30 μL of stop detection solution to stop the kinase reaction, centrifuge at 1000 rpm for 30 seconds, shake and mix;

(10) The conversion rate was read with Caliper EZ Reader.

3: Data Analysis

Calculation formula:

Where: Conversion%_sample is the conversion rate reading of the sample; Conversion%_min: the mean value of the negative control wells, representing the conversion rate readings of the wells without enzymatic activity; Conversion%_max: the mean ratio of the positive control wells, representing the conversion rate readings of the wells without compound inhibition .

Fit dose-response curve

Taking the log value of the concentration as the X-axis and the percentage inhibition rate as the Y-axis, the log(inhibitor) vs.response-Variable slope of the analysis software GraphPad Prism 5 was used to fit the dose-response curve, so as to obtain the IC50 value of each compound on the enzyme activity .

The calculation formula is Y=Bottom+(Top-Bottom)/(1+10^((LogIC50-X)*HillSlope)).

Test Example 2: Liver Microsome Stability Test

1: To the wells of T0, T5, T10, T20, T30, T60 and NCF60 samples, add 10 μL test or reference working solution and 80 μL microsomal working solution (liver microsomal protein concentration is 0.5 mg/mL), Add only the microsomal working solution to the Blank60 well, and then place the samples Blank60, T5, T10, T20, T30 and T60 except for T0 and NCF60 in a 37°C water bath and pre-incubate for about 10 minutes;

2: Add 300μL of stop solution (acetonitrile solution containing 200ng/mL tolbutamide and 200ng/mL lab

the corresponding medium, count, and prepare a cell suspension of appropriate density.

(3) Add the cell suspension to a 96-well plate, 100 μL per well.

(4) cells were cultured at 37 ℃, 5% CO 2 incubator overnight.

3: Preparation of Compounds

(1) The compounds to be tested were diluted with DMSO to prepare a stock solution with a final concentration of 20 mM for later use.

(2) The stock solution was diluted 10-fold from 20 mM to 2 mM with DMSO, and then 3-fold diluted from 2 mM to 9 concentrations.

(3) Blank control wells were cells plus 0.5% DMSO, as high reading control wells.

(4) Wells with no cells and only medium were used as low reading control wells.

4: Compound Treatment of Cells

(1) After 24 hours of cell plating, the compound was used alone, and 99 μL of growth medium was added to each well, and then 1 μL of the compound prepared in step 4.3 a) b) c) was added, and the mixture was shaken gently to ensure uniform mixing, and then placed at 37°C, 5% CO 2 incubator.

(2) Place the cell plate in an incubator for 72 hours.

5: CTG method detection

(1) Place the cell plate to be tested for 30 minutes at room temperature, and discard 100 μL of medium per well.

(2) Add 100 μL of CTG reagent (CelltiterGlo kit) to each well, place on a fast shaker for 2 minutes, and place at room temperature for 30 minutes in the dark.

(3) Read the chemiluminescence signal value with Envision instrument.

6: Data Analysis

IC 50 was calculated with GraphPad Prism 8software, and the following nonlinear fitting formula was used to obtain the IC 50 (50% inhibitory concentration) of the compound. The results are shown in the following table:

Y=Bottom+(Top-Bottom)/(1+10^((LogIC 50 -X)*HillSlope))

X: log value of compound concentration, Y: inhibition rate (% inhibition)

Inhibition rate (%inhibition)=(high reading control reading-compound well reading)/(high reading control reading-low reading control reading)*100

Test Example 5: HER2 Kinase Activity Test

1. Her2 Kinase Test Steps

1) Prepare 1X kinase reaction buffer: 1 volume of 5X kinase reaction buffer and 4 volumes of water, 1 mM dithiothreitol, 5 mM magnesium chloride, 1 mM manganese chloride, 12.5 mM SEB.

2) Use Echo 550 to transfer 100nl of diluted compound working solution to each well of the reaction plate (784075, Greiner). The reaction plate was sealed with sealing film and centrifuged at 1000g for 1 minute.

3) Prepare 1 ng/μL Her2 kinase solution with 1× Kinase Reaction Buffer.

4) Add 5 μL of the above-prepared kinase solution to each well of the reaction plate. Seal the plate with sealing film, centrifuge at 1000g for 1 minute, and place at room temperature for 10 minutes.

5) Prepare 2× kinase substrate and ATP mixture with 1× kinase reaction buffer, 2× Her2 kinase substrate is 2 μM TK-substrate-biotin and 4 μM ATP.

6) Add 5 μL of 2×TK-substrate-biotin and ATP mixture to the reaction plate, and centrifuge at 1000g for 30 seconds to start the reaction.

7) Her2 Kinase Assay React at room temperature for 50 minutes.

8) Prepare a mixture of Sa-XL 665 (125nM) and TK-antibody-Cryptate with HTRF detection buffer.

9) Add 10 μL of Sa-XL 665 and TK-antibody-Cryptate mixture to each well, centrifuge at 1000g for 30 seconds, and react at room temperature for 1 hour.

10) Fluorescence signals at 615 nm (Cryptate) and 665 nm (XL665) were read with Envision 2104.

2. Data Analysis

1) The percent inhibition is calculated as follows:

Average of Ratio 665/615nm of all positive control wells in the whole plate.

Average of Ratio 665/615nm of all negative control wells in the whole plate.

2) Calculate IC50 and fit compound dose-response curve:

Using GraphPad 6.0, the following nonlinear fit formula was used to obtain the IC50 of the compound.

Y=Bottom+(Top-Bottom)/(1+10^((LogIC50-X)*HillSlope))

X: compound concentration log value; Y: compound inhibition percentage

Test Example 6: Blood-brain barrier permeability test

The pharmacokinetics of each test compound was studied by single oral administration in SD rats at a dose of 10 mg/kg, 9 animals in each group. The test compound was dissolved in 5% DMSO+10% solutol+85% saline, vortexed for 1-2 min, and sonicated for 5-10 min to prepare a colorless, transparent and clear dosing solution. Animals were fasted overnight before administration, and 3 SD rats were taken 1h, 2h, and 4h after administration, and about 0.2-0.3 mL of blood was collected from the orbit. The blood samples were placed on ice immediately after collection, and the plasma was centrifuged within 15 minutes (centrifugation conditions: 8000 rpm, 1 minute, room temperature). Collected plasma was stored at –20°C until analysis. The cerebrospinal fluid and brain tissue were collected immediately after blood collection. Cerebrospinal fluid was extracted by dural puncture with a micro-injector under direct vision. After chloral hydrate anesthesia, the head was fixed, the back hair was cut off, and a transverse incision (2cm) was cut at the connection line between the two ears. The muscle layer of the neck and skull base was scraped open to expose the foramen magnum. With a 100 μl microinjector, about 100 μl of cerebrospinal fluid was taken and stored at –20°C before analysis. The rats were then immediately sacrificed, decapitated, and the brain tissue was dissected ou
